title: Nvidia Just Delivered Another Blowout Quarter. Here Are 3 Crucial Things You Shouldn't Miss.
text: Nvidia (NVDA -8.48%) is known for hitting it out of the park when it comes to earnings, surpassing analysts' estimates quarter after quarter and reporting record levels of revenue. This is thanks to the company's dominance in the red-hot growth area of artificial intelligence (AI), a $200 billion market forecast to reach $1 trillion by the end of the decade.

title: Nvidia Q4 Earnings Review: Losing On AI Inference
text: Nvidia beat EPS and revenue estimates, but margin compression and high TCO for inference GPUs remain significant concerns, making shares a strong sell. Despite impressive Q4 results, Nvidia's gross margins fell below expectations, and management anticipates further declines due to the Blackwell architecture ramp-up. Nvidia's valuation remains high compared to sector medians, and shrinking margins could lead to P/E multiple compression, presenting downside risks.

title: Singapore charges three with fraud that media link to Nvidia chips
text: Singapore charged three men with fraud in a case domestic media have linked to the movement of Nvidia's advanced chips from the city state to Chinese artificial intelligence firm DeepSeek.

title: Nvidia CEO: Consumer AI adoption is incredibly fast
text: Nvidia founder and CEO Jensen Huang unpacks the next phase of artificial intelligence on 'The Claman Countdown.'

text: Jonathan Curtis from Franklin Equity Group says Nvidia is absolutely the premium name in AI infrastructure, but there are good opportunities to capture value in software application space "down the market cap spectrum".

title: Nvidia: 3 Key Takeaways From The Earnings Season
text: Nvidia's earnings report is one of my highlights of the earnings season with always interesting takeaways from the technological world. Nvidia hasn't just delivered strong results, but also reestablished its dominance and ground floor for future growth. Blackwell's performance exceeds the management's expectations, as hyperscalers shared optimistic guidance in terms of AI spending.

title: Nvidia stock: 3 fundamentals for investors to consider

title: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq futures mixed after Nvidia earnings beat
text: To get the latest market news, check out finance.yahoo.com US futures attached to the major gauges saw modest gains Wednesday evening as investors processed Nvidia's latest earnings report. Futures linked to the S&P 500 (ES=F) crept up 0.1%, while Nasdaq 100 (NQ=F) futures advanced 0.1%, and Dow Jones (YM=F) futures fluttered just below the baseline.

title: Nasdaq, S&P 500 sell-off as Nvidia sinks 8%, Trump reiterates tariff plans
text: To get the latest market news, check out finance.yahoo.com Stocks plummeted on Thursday as tech sold off following Nvidia's (NVDA) latest earnings report while investors took stock of the economy amid President Trump's latest tariff pledges. The S&P 500 (^GSPC) fell more than 1.6%, while the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite (^IXIC) dropped 2.8%.

title: Nvidia stock falls 4%, leads semiconductor sector lower
text: To get the latest market news check out finance.yahoo.com Tech stocks dropped as Nvidia (NVDA) fell nearly 4% midday as Wall Street pointed to the AI chip giant's outlook for first quarter gross margin as a sticking point following fourth quarter earnings which topped expectations. Yahoo Finance's Laura Bratton reports: Nvidia guided for a gross margin of roughly 71% for the first quarter, lower than its 73% gross margin in the fourth quarter.

title: Nvidia And The Law Of Large Numbers
text: Nvidia Corporation's growth is slowing, evidenced by declining margins and underperformance against the S&P 500 over the past 8 months. The company's lofty valuation (P/E > 43) requires substantial growth, which is hindered by the law of large numbers and increasing competition. Major competitors like Apple, Intel, and Amazon are ramping up efforts, posing significant threats to Nvidia's market share in the long term.

title: Nvidia margins will return to mid-70s as Blackwell ramps up, says Stifel's Ruben Roy

title: Nvidia Is Still Experiencing Amazing Growth
text: Nvidia Corporation's revenue growth outpaces rivals AMD and Intel, solidifying its dominance in the data center market. Nvidia's strategy of catering to a wide range of customers, unlike AMD and Google, ensures continued growth despite competition and export restrictions. The company's use of AI in chip design accelerates innovation, contributing to rapid product development and maintaining a competitive edge.

title: Nvidia's Q4 And The Trillion Dollar Question: Does DeepSeek Matter?
text: Nvidia Corporation's Q4 report was strong. Driven by Blackwell's success, the company produced ~$40 billion in revenue and $0.89 EPS, beating analyst estimates. Concerns about DeepSeek's cost efficiency impacted Nvidia's stock in January, but further analysis indicates that the startup's costs may be higher than reported, which should ease investor worries. Cloud providers also reaffirmed Capex guidance, indicating sustained demand for NVDA's data center products, which should support top and bottom-line growth.

title: NVDA CEO Sees More Computer Demand Despite DeepSeek, Analysts Beat Bull Drum

title: Nvidia: A Bumpy Road Ahead This Year, But I'm Still Bullish Over The Longer Term
text: Nvidia Corporation delivered a strong set of results, but the mid-term outlook looks somewhat mixed. Reasoning models capable of complex tasks may significantly boost demand for Nvidia's hardware in the foreseeable future. I reiterate my “Buy” rating on NVDA stock due to the promising developments in AI that may continue to sustain the long-term growth of Nvidia's business.

title: Why The Market Isn't Raising The Roof On Nvidia's Blockbuster Earnings
text: Nvidia Corporation's FY 2025 earnings showed positive revenue trends but were tempered by rising costs and nuanced market reactions, leading to a modest stock increase. The company's shift to corporate clients and data centers has stabilized revenue but reduced diversification, with gaming division revenues declining significantly. Concerns include the potential underperformance of the new Blackwell architecture in data centers and geopolitical risks affecting sales due to U.S. export restrictions.

title: Nvidia: Revising Estimates Lower
text: Revised my intrinsic value estimate for Nvidia to $1.9T, 40% lower than its current market cap, and reiterate a SELL rating. Nvidia's Q1 FY 2026 revenue and gross margin outlook were below my forecasts, prompting a downward revision in my estimates. Increased operating expenses forecast for FY 2026 and FY 2027, reflecting potentially lower operating leverage and higher costs.

title: Nvidia: The Shift Towards Reasoning Models And The Importance Of Hedging

I believe Nvidia Corporation's record Q4 data center revenue and Blackwell AI's rapid adoption confirm the high demand for AI infrastructure. Nvidia projects $5 billion in automotive AI revenue this fiscal year, nearly tripling last year's sales.
